original: de bzhin du gnyi ga la yang gnyi gar ma yin no zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //ğŸ”½'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad par gnas pa'i gnas skabs yin pa de'i tshe de tha dad pa'i sor mo 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyi ga la yang gnyi gar ma yin no zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o // 'on kyang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad par gnas pa'i gnas skabs yin pa de'i tshe de tha dad pa'i sor mo 'am /
translated: Likewise, it is a non-observation of a pervader to say, â€œNeither is the case.â€

original: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin nam ma yin zhes rnam par brtag pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin nam ma yin zhes rnam par brtag pa gnyis te /
translated: However, when the state of being different in some way is present, then there are two alternatives: either it is a different finger, or it has become its nature.

original: dang po skyon brjod pa ni tha dad ba de nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa de nyid dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dang po skyon brjod pa ni tha dad ba de nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa de nyid dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba lta bu'o //
translated: The first error is that if it is a different finger, then the defining characteristic of a different thing would be like pleasure and pain.

original: gnyis pa'i bshad pa gzhan du gyur pa ni khyad par bskyed na yang brkyang ba'i sor mo nyid dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i bshad pa gzhan du gyur pa ni khyad par bskyed na yang brkyang ba'i sor mo nyid dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: The explanation of the second alternative is that if it generates a difference, then the extended finger would be observed,

original: khu tshur gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: khu tshur gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: because it would be a difference in the state of making a fist.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang gi phyir gang gi rang bzhin 'pho ba med pa'i don bzhin skye na ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi rang bzhin 'pho ba med pa'i don bzhin skye na ni /
translated: Because if it were generated in the same way that the meaning of an unchanging nature is generated,

original: rnam pa gzhan mi dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sor mo'i don las gzhan pa'i glang po'i phru gu skye ba bzhin du dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba yang gang gi rang bzhin 'pho ba med pa de'i don las skye ba yangğŸ”½gzhan du dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sor mo'i don las gzhan pa'i glang po'i phru gu skye ba bzhin du dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba yang gang gi rang bzhin 'pho ba med pa de'i don las skye ba yang gzhan du dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not transferred from its own nature, its birth is observed as different from its object,

original: dper na @93b rnga mo dang glang po'i skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na @93b rnga mo dang glang po'i skye ba bzhin no //
translated: like the birth of a camel and an elephant.ğŸ”½The syllogism is: The finger is not born as different from its own nature, because it is not transferred from its own nature.

original: 'pho ba med pa rang gi rang bzhin las sor mo tha dad pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag la yang gtan tshigs rnam grangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa rang gi rang bzhin las sor mo tha dad pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag la yang gtan tshigs rnam grangs pa yin no //
translated: The reason is a variant of the previous one.

original: rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of a contradictory cause and the non-observation of a cause are the two.

original: rdzas kho na zhe na bya ba la sogs pa pha rol po'o //
analyzed: rdzas kho na zhe na bya ba la sogs pa pha rol po'o //
translated: If you say it is only a substance, the opponent says it is action and so on.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med par de skad bshad pa ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med par de skad bshad pa ni ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement that it is inexpressible as either the same or different is the meaning of the statement.

original: slob dpon gyis smras su zin kyang 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis smras su zin kyang 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if the master were to say this, it is not logical.

original: ji ltar rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not logical?ğŸ”½It is said:

original: bshad pa / yod pa nyid kyi dngos po de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / yod pa nyid kyi dngos po de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang bral ba'i rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That very existent thing is devoid of another aspect that is the same or different.

original: gang dngos por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba gzhan sel ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dngos por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba gzhan sel ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The other exclusions, such as the exclusion of what is other, are taught as a fabrication by the conceptualization that apprehends things as real.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni zhes bya la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said:

original: sbyor ba yang dag phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang dag phan tshun spangs te /
translated: Because those are mutually exclusive.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gcig spong ba dang gzhan len pa med pa mi 'byung ba dang gcig len pa dang gzhan spong ba med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gcig spong ba dang gzhan len pa med pa mi 'byung ba dang gcig len pa dang gzhan spong ba med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The application is that the characteristics of mutually exclusive things do not occur without one being taken up and the other being rejected.

original: dper na dngos po dngos po med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dngos po dngos po med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a thing and a non-thing.

original: de nyid dam gzhan nyid rnam pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan nyid rnam pa yang ji skad bshad pa'i chos dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: That very thing or something else has the aspect of being endowed with the qualities explained above. This is a natural inference.

original: sor mo khu tshur de nyid las gzhan nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sor mo khu tshur de nyid las gzhan nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The fist is not something other than the fingers, nor does it have another aspect.

original: sor mo nyid khu tshur ma yin te brkyang ba nyid khu tshur ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sor mo nyid khu tshur ma yin te brkyang ba nyid khu tshur ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fingers themselves are not the fist, because the extended fingers are not the fist.

original: don gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not a different object,

original: rang bzhin logs shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin logs shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because a separate nature is not observed.

original: sor mo dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sor mo dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œThe fingers themselves,â€ and so on.

original: skad cig ma re re 'gag pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re 'gag pa gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What ceases in every moment does not exist.

original: de nyid skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di lta bu skye ba dag dang ldan pa dag gis khu tshur la sogs pa brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di lta bu skye ba dag dang ldan pa dag gis khu tshur la sogs pa brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is momentary, it has the aspect of arising in this way. Those who possess it call it a fist and so on. This is the meaning.

original: des na dngos po 'di la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos po 'di la yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this thing is also not so.

original: khu tshur ni sor mo dag gi khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin kyang skabs gsal bar bshad par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: khu tshur ni sor mo dag gi khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin kyang skabs gsal bar bshad par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: But it is the intention to explain this in a clear manner in this context.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: If it were not so, what would be the use of this?

original: gal te de lta na 'o na khu tshur dang sor mo zhes bya ba sgra tha dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na khu tshur dang sor mo zhes bya ba sgra tha dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that the words â€œfistâ€ and â€œfingersâ€ are different?

original: bshad pa / de la khu tshur la @94a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la khu tshur la @94a * //
translated: In response, it is said:

original: sogs pa'i sgra khyad par can gyi yul can yin te sor mo'i gnas skabs khyad par nyid la brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½sor mo'i sgra ni spyi'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra khyad par can gyi yul can yin te sor mo'i gnas skabs khyad par nyid la brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // sor mo'i sgra ni spyi'i yul can yin te /
translated: The words â€œfistâ€ and so on refer to a specific state, because they express a specific state of the fingers.ğŸ”½The word â€œfingersâ€ refers to a general state,

original: sor mo'i sgra ni yul can yin te /
analyzed: sor mo'i sgra ni yul can yin te /
translated: because the word â€œfingersâ€ refers to a general state,

original: gnas thams cad la de brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas thams cad la de brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it expresses all states.

original: rim pa bzhin du dpe gnyis bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du dpe gnyis bshad pa ni /
translated: The two examples are explained in order.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa'i sgra dang 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa'i sgra dang 'bru la sogs pa'i sgra lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the words â€œseed,â€ â€œsprout,â€ and so on, and the words â€œgrain,â€ and so on.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs ma lus pa 'byed par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs ma lus pa 'byed par byed pa 'am /
translated: Thus, one who wishes to refute all the positions of others,ğŸ”½or who wishes to be victorious in all the arguments advanced by others,

original: gzhan gyi la lar nye bar bkod pa ma lus pa las rgyal bar 'dod pas gzhan gyi sgo nas rtsod pa nye bar bkod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi la lar nye bar bkod pa ma lus pa las rgyal bar 'dod pas gzhan gyi sgo nas rtsod pa nye bar bkod pa ni /
translated: should use the arguments of others.ğŸ”½In this regard, if you say â€œif this exists, that arises,â€

original: de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea here is as follows:

original: dper na til la mar yod pa ma yin na til la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na til la mar yod pa ma yin na til la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If oil does not exist in sesame seeds, then oil would not arise from sesame seeds.

original: gal te skabs kyi rgyu las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te skabs kyi rgyu las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If an effect arises from a cause that is present at the time,

original: de'i tshe til las kyang mar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe til las kyang mar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then oil would arise from sesame seeds.

original: med pa'i phyir yang na til yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: med pa'i phyir yang na til yang ma yin te ;
translated: But it does not, because it does not exist.ğŸ”½Or, if it does not exist, then sesame seeds do not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mar bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mar bzhin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is like oil.

original: 'ga' zhig med pa bzhin du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang 'dod pas mngon par 'dod pa'i khyab par byed pa khyab par bya ba dag sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa dag
analyzed: 'ga' zhig med pa bzhin du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang 'dod pas mngon par 'dod pa'i khyab par byed pa khyab par bya ba dag sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa dag
translated: This is a natural inference. The nonobservation of a difference and the pervasion of the pervader by the pervaded, which is asserted by the opponent, are the modes of proof.

original: yin no // des na 'di dag thams cad bdag nyid gsang ba'i phyir bya ba byed khyed cag yin no snyam du bsams nas thams cad la thams cad yod pa nyid yang skyon mtshungs pa ma yin nam 'ga' zhig la bye brag med pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // des na 'di dag thams cad bdag nyid gsang ba'i phyir bya ba byed khyed cag yin no snyam du bsams nas thams cad la thams cad yod pa nyid yang skyon mtshungs pa ma yin nam 'ga' zhig la bye brag med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of these are the same.

original: sbyor ba ni spyod pa'i phyir zhes pa bya ba ni khyed nyid kyi bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni spyod pa'i phyir zhes pa bya ba ni khyed nyid kyi bzhin no //
translated: The application is â€œbecause of the performance of function.â€ The performance of function is like your own.

original: gtan tshigs bzlog nas spyod pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bzlog nas spyod pa byas pa yin no //
translated: The performance of function is done by reversing the reason.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kyang bye brag med pa'i phyir ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kyang bye brag med pa'i phyir ni //
translated: However, because there is no difference,

original: des na yod kyang thams cad las thams cad mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yod kyang thams cad las thams cad mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even though it exists, it is not the case that everything arises from everything.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma dag las mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzlog pa la the tshom za ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma dag las mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzlog pa la the tshom za ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is doubt about the reversal of the opposite position from the valid cognitions.

original: bshad pa / bye brag yod par bya ba yin na khyad par du de rdul dang mun pa snying stobs kyi yon tan gsum las tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad pa / bye brag yod par bya ba yin na khyad par du de rdul dang mun pa snying stobs kyi yon tan gsum las tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were to be made distinct, then it would be distinct from the three qualities of rajas, tamas, and sattva.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan gsum de yod du zin kyang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gsum de yod du zin kyang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even if those three qualities exist, there is no cause for following the distinction.

original: sbyor ba ni gang yod kyang gang yod pa'i rjes su mi @94b 'gro ba de dang de las shin tu tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang yod kyang gang yod pa'i rjes su mi @94b 'gro ba de dang de las shin tu tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not follow the existence of something, is completely distinct from that.

original: dper na sgra dang gzugs dang dri dang ro las sems pa can yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra dang gzugs dang dri dang ro las sems pa can yin no //
translated: For example, the mind is distinct from sound, form, smell, and taste.

original: yon tan gsum gyi dngos po yang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi dngos po yang khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba med pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The entity of the three qualities does not follow the distinction. This is a natural inference.

original: khas blang par bya ca ba de dag nye bar brjod nas da ni 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i skye ba'i don nyid kyang rigs pa ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: khas blang par bya ca ba de dag nye bar brjod nas da ni 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i skye ba'i don nyid kyang rigs pa ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: Having thus stated the assertions of the opponent, now, thinking that the meaning of arising is also not tenable for the proponents of existence,

original: yod pa nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½de'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa mi skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa mi skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: he says, â€œIf it exists, etc. â€

original: yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect that is desired does not arise, because it exists.ğŸ”½Like that which has been accomplished.

original: grub pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yod pa la bsams pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yod pa la bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the pervasion by the contradictory.

original: de lta de lta ma yin na skyes zin pa yang skye bar thal bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta de lta ma yin na skyes zin pa yang skye bar thal bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would follow, absurdly, that that which has already arisen would arise again, and there would be an infinite regress.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: yod pa gal te skyes gyur na //
analyzed: yod pa gal te skyes gyur na //
translated: If that which exists were to arise,

original: skyes zin dngos de yang 'byung 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bshad do //
analyzed: skyes zin dngos de yang 'byung 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: then that which has arisen would arise again.

original: gzhan yang sgrub par byed pa dang / rgyu dang sa bon dang me dang chu la sogs pa 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrub par byed pa dang / rgyu dang sa bon dang me dang chu la sogs pa 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it would follow, absurdly, that the means of accomplishing, the cause, the seed, fire, water, etc., would be without effect.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang bya ba 'ga' zhig ngo bo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang bya ba 'ga' zhig ngo bo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object to be established and the action are not at all entities.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la bsgrub par bya ba cung zad cig kyang med pa bsgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu med pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la bsgrub par bya ba cung zad cig kyang med pa bsgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu med pa yin te /
translated: The application is the absence of the effect of establishing that which does not exist at all as an object to be established.

original: dper na nam mkha' la khyab par byar med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la khyab par byar med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the absence of pervasion in space.

original: rgyur rnam par gzhag pa la yod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba cung zad cig kyang med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur rnam par gzhag pa la yod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba cung zad cig kyang med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since there is not the slightest object to be established that is posited as a cause, there is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: 'di gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is not an unestablished reason.

original: gang la sa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig khyad par du gyur pa de la rgyu gnas pa'i 'bras bu ci zhig ltar skye ba 'dod na 'di khyad par bcas pa ni de la med na ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la sa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig khyad par du gyur pa de la rgyu gnas pa'i 'bras bu ci zhig ltar skye ba 'dod na 'di khyad par bcas pa ni de la med na ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If one asserts that the effect of the abiding cause arises in some way in that which has become distinguished by any ground, how could it arise if that which has distinctions does not exist there?

original: skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise.

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: nam mkha'i autpala lta bur 'o ma la yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs par sems pa la gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i autpala lta bur 'o ma la yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs par sems pa la gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The phrase in the case of milk, too, like a sky-lotus is meant to establish the non-observation of the pervader.

original: 'on te de med kyang khyad par skye ba yin na de skye ba med pa skye ba bas med kyang khyad par thams cad thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de med kyang khyad par skye ba yin na de skye ba med pa skye ba bas med kyang khyad par thams cad thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: But if a particular is produced even when that [universal] does not exist, then all particulars would be produced from all [other] particulars, even when there is no production of a particular. The objection and analysis are the same.

original: khyed kyi til las mar khyad par du skye ba yang med pa'i phyir til gyi khyad bar bzhin du @95a * //
analyzed: khyed kyi til las mar khyad par du skye ba yang med pa'i phyir til gyi khyad bar bzhin du @95a * //
translated: Because even in your [SÄá¹ƒkhya] system, oil is not produced as a particular from sesame seeds, [the same problem arises]. Like the particular of sesame seeds means that the same problem arises.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that [the particular] would be produced from all [other] particulars.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: [The SÄá¹ƒkhya] says, â€œThere is no fallacy of accident in the case of a natural reason.â€

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: [The author] anticipates an objection from the other [SÄá¹ƒkhya]:

original: gal te khyad par de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œIf that particular . . .â€ and so on.

original: gal ltar yang med pa de ji ltar de las med pa'i rnam pas skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba spong pa'i don to //
analyzed: gal ltar yang med pa de ji ltar de las med pa'i rnam pas skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba spong pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the response is this: â€œHow could that non-existent be produced by a non-existent particular?â€

original: skye na thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so zhes sngar bshad pa rnams kyir rjes su zhes sngar bshad pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: skye na thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so zhes sngar bshad pa rnams kyir rjes su zhes sngar bshad pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: â€œIf it arises, it would arise from everythingâ€ is the same kind of argument.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ltar yang khyad par yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ltar yang khyad par yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œIn that case, it would be a specific characteristic that exists in every way.â€

original: 'di ltar re zhig de yod pa dang med pa'i 'bras bu smra ba thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba skyon mtshungs par bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig de yod pa dang med pa'i 'bras bu smra ba thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba skyon mtshungs par bstan zin to //
translated: As such, first, the error that â€œit would arise from everything, whether it exists or notâ€ has already been explained.

original: gnyi ga yang rtsod pa mtshungs pa de gcig la brjod par ni mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rtsod pa mtshungs pa de gcig la brjod par ni mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: Since both are the same in the argument, it is not right to say that it is only one.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid la skyed pa'i don du cung zad cig kyang med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid la skyed pa'i don du cung zad cig kyang med do zhes ston to //
translated: Since it is the assertion of existence, there is not the slightest purpose in generating it.

original: des na 'di lhag pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di lhag pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the additional error.

original: de 'di ltar nges 'ga' pha rol pos brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de 'di ltar nges 'ga' pha rol pos brjod pa ni /
translated: He should be certain of this, and he should say to the other:ğŸ”½â€œIf I do not completely abandon this position, then you will certainly be able to refute it.

original: 'o na gal te kho bos de yongs su ma spangs na khyed kyis nges par gnas par 'gyur na /ğŸ”½'ga' zhig rang gi phyogs bsrung ba ni pha rol gyi phyogs la skyon brjod pas rang gi phyogs nas pa kha na ma thob pa med pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½sgra ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te kho bos de yongs su ma spangs na khyed kyis nges par gnas par 'gyur na / 'ga' zhig rang gi phyogs bsrung ba ni pha rol gyi phyogs la skyon brjod pas rang gi phyogs nas pa kha na ma thob pa med pa rnyed par 'gyur ro // sgra ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: But if you do not completely abandon your position, then I will certainly be able to refute it.â€ğŸ”½Sound is permanent, because it is not corporeal, like pleasure, etc.

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir bde bal sogs pa ma nges pas dang po'i mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir bde bal sogs pa ma nges pas dang po'i mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: The first reason is not established, because sound is impermanent.ğŸ”½If an effect does not exist in its cause, then what is produced?

original: rgyu las 'bras bu med pa yang skye ba yang gang yang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na de nyid las de skyed pa yin gyi gzhan skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu med pa yang skye ba yang gang yang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin na de nyid las de skyed pa yin gyi gzhan skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: If the nature of the producer is to produce that, then it produces that, but not something else.

original: yang smos pa ni srid par rung ngo //
analyzed: yang smos pa ni srid par rung ngo //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ is used to indicate that it is possible.

original: don 'di la 'di med pa nyid de mar med du zin kyang til rnams las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: don 'di la 'di med pa nyid de mar med du zin kyang til rnams las skye ba yin te /
translated: In this case, the effect does not exist in the cause, but it is produced from sesame seeds, even though sesame oil does not exist in them.

original: de skyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the potency to generate it.

original: til mar ni gzhan las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: til mar ni gzhan las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Oil does not arise from another,ğŸ”½because its potency is incomplete, and because its potency is restricted to that.

original: nus pa ma tshang ba'i phyir dang de'i nus pa so sor nges pa nyid la ji ltar yin zhe na /ğŸ”½brgal zhing brtag par byed ce na /
analyzed: nus pa ma tshang ba'i phyir dang de'i nus pa so sor nges pa nyid la ji ltar yin zhe na / brgal zhing brtag par byed ce na /
translated: If you ask how,

original: ji lta ba yin pa dngos po'i nyid kyis lan 'debs par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½dper na gtso bo las chen po ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba yin pa dngos po'i nyid kyis lan 'debs par 'gyur ro // dper na gtso bo las chen po ste /
translated: we reply that the way things are is the way they are.

original: chen po skye'i nga rgyal ni @95b ma yin /
analyzed: chen po skye'i nga rgyal ni @95b ma yin /
translated: For example, the SÄá¹ƒkhyas have a scriptural tradition that states, â€œThe great arises from primal substance,ğŸ”½but not from the I-principle,ğŸ”½and the I-principle arises from the great, but not from the five subtle objects.â€

original: chen po las nga rgyal yin gyi de tsam lnga ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung lugs de la byed nus pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa nyid skyabs yin te /
analyzed: chen po las nga rgyal yin gyi de tsam lnga ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung lugs de la byed nus pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa nyid skyabs yin te /
translated: In that scriptural tradition, the restriction of potency to a specific object is the refuge,ğŸ”½because there is no other way to respond.

original: gzhan lan gdab pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du kho bos kyang 'di khvas zos pa ma yin pa des na rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan lan gdab pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du kho bos kyang 'di khvas zos pa ma yin pa des na rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, we also say, â€œI did not eat the food,â€ and therefore it is not illogical.

original: med par 'ga' zhig la khyad par med do zhes bya ba de ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par 'ga' zhig la khyad par med do zhes bya ba de ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that something that does not exist is in any way similar to something that does exist.

original: rgyu nus pa dang mi nus pas byas pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba dang mi skyu ba yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: rgyu nus pa dang mi nus pas byas pa'i phyir 'bras bu skye ba dang mi skyu ba yin pa de bas na /
translated: The effect arises or does not arise depending on whether the cause is able or unable to generate it.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshad ma dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa las the tshom za ba sgrub par byed pa dri ma can gyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshad ma dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa las the tshom za ba sgrub par byed pa dri ma can gyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the proof that is based on the reversal of the counter-evidence of the previously explained valid cognitions is a fallacious proof.

original: skye ba'i rang bzhin nges pa de yang de'i rgyu las yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rang bzhin nges pa de yang de'i rgyu las yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the nature of arising is due to its cause.

original: yod pa gang las skyes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa gang las skyes pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what does existence arise?

original: de yang de'i rang bzhin nges pa ni rang gi rgyu las yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang de'i rang bzhin nges pa ni rang gi rgyu las yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The ascertainment of its nature is due to its cause.

original: de yang gang las yin zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang gang las yin zhe na bshad pa /
translated: From what does that arise?

original: de ltar thogs pa med pa nas dngos po'i rang bzhin nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thogs pa med pa nas dngos po'i rang bzhin nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the nature of an entity is due to its unobstructed cause.

original: 'di thog ma yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di thog ma yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The word â€œexistenceâ€ is to be supplied.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu thog ma med nas khas blangs pas rang bzhin rgyud par 'gyur ba la thug pa med pa'i skyon cung zad kyang med de //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu thog ma med nas khas blangs pas rang bzhin rgyud par 'gyur ba la thug pa med pa'i skyon cung zad kyang med de //
translated: Since cause and effect are accepted as beginningless, there is not the slightest fault of the continuum of intrinsic reality becoming endless.

original: 'gyur byas pa'i lhag ma'o //ğŸ”½de lta ma yin na brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur byas pa'i lhag ma'o // de lta ma yin na brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: The remainder is as was previously explained.

original: rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ba des na /
analyzed: rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ba des na /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable, because it would follow that there would be no cause.

original: de khyed kyi gnas ma yin pa la dogs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de khyed kyi gnas ma yin pa la dogs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that this is not your position, but rather a doubtful point.

original: yang na gzhung 'di gzhan du bshad par bya ste /ğŸ”½rnam grangs med par yod par khyad par du skye ba yod pa de lta na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur na zhes brgal zhing brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhung 'di gzhan du bshad par bya ste / rnam grangs med par yod par khyad par du skye ba yod pa de lta na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur na zhes brgal zhing brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: Or else, this text should be explained differently:ğŸ”½â€œIf it is the case that there is arising of a particular existent that is not a nominal existent, then everything would arise from everything.â€

original: gang gang las skyes pa rang bzhin de nyid las khyad par du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gang las skyes pa rang bzhin de nyid las khyad par du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is not to be disputed, because whatever arises from whatever particular intrinsic reality, it arises from that very intrinsic reality.

original: nus pa so sor nges pa la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la yid ches pa brjod par dgos pa la kho bo'i nus pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa 'ga' zhig gis dbyig pas skyod par byed pa la ni mdo zhes
analyzed: nus pa so sor nges pa la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la yid ches pa brjod par dgos pa la kho bo'i nus pa so sor nges pa la dmigs pa 'ga' zhig gis dbyig pas skyod par byed pa la ni mdo zhes
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: â€œWhen someone who is focused on the individual certainty of ability is struck by a stick, he will say, â€˜I am hurt.â€™

original: dgongs so // med pa skye na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½tshig gi rnam par dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin no //ğŸ”½sbyor ba ni gang dang @96a * //
analyzed: dgongs so // med pa skye na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / tshig gi rnam par dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin no // sbyor ba ni gang dang @96a * //
translated: When something arises from something,

original: gang skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa de dang de las skye ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa de dang de las skye ba yod pa yin te /
translated: the arising of that effect is only from that cause that has the ability to give rise to it.

original: dper na khyad par phul du byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khyad par phul du byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the arising of a special quality.ğŸ”½The arising of a special effect is only from a cause that has the ability to give rise to it.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par yang skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa yod pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par yang skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa yod pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: de de bzhin du gang gang la skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa med pa de dang de la skyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin du gang gang la skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa med pa de dang de la skyes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, whatever does not have the ability to give rise to something does not give rise to it.ğŸ”½For example, like a non-entity.

original: dper na til la mar gyis khyab pa bzhin du'o //ğŸ”½de bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par dang rgyu'i khyad par yang skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa med pas zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na til la mar gyis khyab pa bzhin du'o // de bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par dang rgyu'i khyad par yang skye ba'i rgyu'i nus pa med pas zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like the pervasion of sesame seeds by oil.ğŸ”½Similarly, the pervasion of a particular effect by a particular cause is also not established because of the non-perception of the pervader, i.e., the absence of the capacity to produce.

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rtags ni med pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad las srid pa'i phyir dang / nus pa ni nus pa can gyi rgyu'i phyir dang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa don med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rtags ni med pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'dzin pa'i phyir thams cad las srid pa'i phyir dang / nus pa ni nus pa can gyi rgyu'i phyir dang rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa don med do //
translated: Moreover, the reason that proves by way of a categorized [position] is also meaningless, such as, â€œBecause it is not a non-cause of non-existence and because it is the cause that holds the appropriated [aggregates], everything is possible. Because capacity is the cause of the capable, and because it is the entity of the cause, the effect exists.â€

original: bsgrub par bya ba don 'ga' zhig la the tshom dang phyin ci log pa de rnam par gcod pa nges pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang bsgrub pa thams cad kyi rgol ba'i tshig gi dngos po ni the tshom dang phyin ci log dang sgrub par byed
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba don 'ga' zhig la the tshom dang phyin ci log pa de rnam par gcod pa nges pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba dang bsgrub pa thams cad kyi rgol ba'i tshig gi dngos po ni the tshom dang phyin ci log dang sgrub par byed
translated: and the arising of a definite cognition that eliminates doubt and misconception with regard to some object to be established.

original: pa gang yin pa de'i nges pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rjes su mthun par 'jug go //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de'i nges pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rjes su mthun par 'jug go //
translated: All proofs engage in accordance with the arising of a definite cognition that eliminates doubt, misconception, and the proof with regard to the object of the opponent.

original: gnyi ga yang ser skya'i gzhung la de mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ser skya'i gzhung la de mi srid pa yin te /
translated: Both of these are impossible in the texts of Kapila,

original: 'bras bu yod pa rnam par gnas pa la skye ba dang 'jig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa rnam par gnas pa la skye ba dang 'jig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is illogical for arising and disintegration to exist for an existent effect that endures.

original: 'on te yod kyang mi gsal ba 'di nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'di tshig las gsal thabs gzhan yin pas 'bras bu med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yod kyang mi gsal ba 'di nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'di tshig las gsal thabs gzhan yin pas 'bras bu med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But even if it exists, if it is unclear, this definite proof is a method of clarification other than the words, so it is not the case that it is without effect.

original: bshad pa / khyad par 'ga' zhig gsal bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / khyad par 'ga' zhig gsal bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la bsgrub par bya ba nges pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: NÄgÄrjuna responds: Whatever is a definition that clarifies some specific thing is the ascertained nature of the probandum.

original: ci zhig ltar med pa skye ba sngar bshad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par de la ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci zhig ltar med pa skye ba sngar bshad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par de la ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist in some way arise? The specific proof that was explained earlier, how could it arise?

original: skye na yang thams cad kyi khyad par gyi ma lus pa'i bsgrub par bya ba nges par mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub pa ltar snang ba gzhan thams cad las skye bar mtshungs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye na yang thams cad kyi khyad par gyi ma lus pa'i bsgrub par bya ba nges par mngon par gsal ba'i mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub pa ltar snang ba gzhan thams cad las skye bar mtshungs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did arise, then it would follow that all specific things would arise from all other proofs and pseudo-proofs, since they are all equally unarisen.

original: pha rol po me la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol po me la sogs pa'i rtogs pa ni /
translated: The opponentâ€™s understanding is this:

original: du ba la sogs @96b pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po yang 'bras bu yod par nges par mngon par gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba la sogs @96b pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po yang 'bras bu yod par nges par mngon par gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The thing that is the reason, such as smoke, is the proof that ascertains and makes evident the existence of the effect.ğŸ”½This is the meaning.

original: mngon par gsal bar khas blangs nas de skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar khas blangs nas de skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: Having accepted that, he says this.

original: 'on 'di rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo dag la byed pa'i gnas dang lhan cig pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo'i gzhan skye ba'i mtshan nyid de de'i yul la rnam par shes pa 'byung ba zhig yin na rang gi ngo bo ni 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on 'di rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo dag la byed pa'i gnas dang lhan cig pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo'i gzhan skye ba'i mtshan nyid de de'i yul la rnam par shes pa 'byung ba zhig yin na rang gi ngo bo ni 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it is a consciousness that arises in regard to an object that has the nature of a transformation, then the nature of the transformation is not a transformation,

original: gzhan pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is capable of establishing itself as something other.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba snga ma'i rang bzhin zhig pa dang snga ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo skye bas 'bras bu med par smra ba sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba snga ma'i rang bzhin zhig pa dang snga ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo skye bas 'bras bu med par smra ba sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The assertion that there is no effect is established by the destruction of the previous nature of the transformation and the arising of a nature that is not previous.

original: gyur pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo 'dir dang 'thob pa mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyur pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo 'dir dang 'thob pa mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the transformation is the attainment of this previous and subsequent nature.

original: sems can ni gcig pa'i phyir gzhan ni de'i shes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can ni gcig pa'i phyir gzhan ni de'i shes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the sentient being is one, another would not be the object of its consciousness.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo gsal bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo gsal bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that what is called â€œanotherâ€ is its nature.

original: ngo bo gzhan skye bar brjod pa ni gzhan du cung zad cig kyang nye bar skye ba ma yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan skye bar brjod pa ni gzhan du cung zad cig kyang nye bar skye ba ma yin na /
translated: The statement â€œthe nature of the other is not producedâ€ means that nothing is produced from the other.ğŸ”½Since the characteristics are not compatible, a third possibility is impossible.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba gsum pa yang mi srid pa la gnyis pa 'di yongs su spangs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba gsum pa yang mi srid pa la gnyis pa 'di yongs su spangs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error of the complete abandonment of the second is also committed.

original: de'i yul dang shes pa la sogs pa yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po phyin ci log mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul dang shes pa la sogs pa yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po phyin ci log mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical for the object, consciousness, etc. to be a different thing, and for the thing to be erroneous.

original: shes pa la phan 'dogs par mi byed pa ni yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa la phan 'dogs par mi byed pa ni yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which does not benefit consciousness does not become its object,

original: de ni phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: because it is that which benefits.

analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin snang ba tha dad pa yon tan dngos po tha dad pa ma yin te /

translated: The phrase â€œthe appearance of the nature is not differentâ€ is meant to illustrate.

analyzed: des na don byed pa tha dad pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must accept that the performance of functions is different.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /

original: gang gi tshe snang ba tha dad pa shes pa tha dad pas sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug rnams ma 'dres par tha dad par rnam par 'jog par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //

translated: When the difference in appearance is established by the difference in consciousness, then pleasure, pain, and delusion are posited as unmixed and different, but not otherwise.

analyzed: de bzhin du 'jim gong dang bum pa gzhan dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa gzhan pa yin zhes rab tu shes te /

original: rnam pa tha dad pa shes par yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa shes par yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad par byung ba yang bde ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //

translated: And the cause and effect arise as mutually different, like pleasure, etc. This is a natural inference.

analyzed: de lta ma yin na bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur @97b te ;

original: de'i phyir zhes pa mjug bsdu ba'o //

original: bum pa la sogs pa de de la dmigs pa nyid rig byar gyur pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ni mi dmigs pas med par rigs so //

original: 'on kyang de gnas pa de med kyang de'i rang bzhin dang de ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa gcig pa'i nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag gi sgrub pa rgya cher ba rjod nas lhag ma rnams kyis mi dmigs par bshad par bya ste /

This is what it means.

analyzed: bya ba dang las rnams kyi khyad par grub zin pa yin na sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te /

original: ma rtogs don gyi gsal byed yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma rtogs don gyi gsal byed yin zhe na /

translated: But if there is no certainty that there is a distance of three hundred cubits, etc., and there is no certainty that there is a particular tree, such as a Å›Äla, a tala, a tamÄla, or a Å›irÄ«á¹£a, then there is no certainty that there is no pervasion at all.

analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni gang la 'bras bu med par nges pa med pa de nyid la rab tu skye ba yin gyi gzhan la don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-apprehension of cause arises only when there is no certainty that the effect is absent, not otherwise, because it would be pointless.

original: dper @98a * //
analyzed: dper @98a * //
translated: For example,

analyzed: na mun pa'i gnas skabs su du ba med pa'i nges pa'i nges pa med pas 'dir me med pas du ba med do zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: in a dark place, there is no certainty that smoke is absent, so it is said that because there is no fire here, there is no smoke.

original: 'bras bu med par the tshom za ba'i phyir dang / rgyu med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par the tshom za ba'i phyir dang / rgyu med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is doubt that the effect is absent, and because there is certainty that the cause is absent.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa yang grang ba'i reg pa med par gnas pa'i yul la the tshom za ba la me 'bar ba'i tshogs 'khrigs pa chen po nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yul la khyab par gnas pa las yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa yang grang ba'i reg pa med par gnas pa'i yul la the tshom za ba la me 'bar ba'i tshogs 'khrigs pa chen po nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yul la khyab par gnas pa las yin no //
translated: The observation of a contradictory object is, for example, the observation of a great mass of blazing fire filling the sky, etc., in a place where cold is suspected but absent.

original: rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa ni me 'bar ba dang nye bar gnas pa'i skyes bu dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs nye bar snang ba na 'dar ba dang ba spu langs pa dang / so thams byed pa la sogs pa'i dngos po tha dad pa med pa nyid rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //

translated: The observation of a contradictory cause is, for example, the application of the absence of a different entity, such as trembling, horripilation, and perspiration, in a place where a person endowed with a blazing fire is nearby.

original: gzhan du don med pa yin gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan du don med pa yin gyi'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be meaningless.

original: 'dis ni yul gzhan mi mtshungs kyang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyi yul bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul gzhan mi mtshungs kyang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyi yul bsam par bya'o //
translated: By this, the objects of the applications of non-observation, even if the objects are different, should be considered.

original: rang bzhin dang khyab par byed pa dang rgyu dang 'gal ba de dag ni nye bar dmigs pa de dag nyid yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang khyab par byed pa dang rgyu dang 'gal ba de dag ni nye bar dmigs pa de dag nyid yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those intrinsic natures, pervaders, causes, and contradictories should be connected with those very objects of observation.

original: 'gal ba gnyis po dag las 'gal ba gcig nye bar bstan pa'i 'gal ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis po dag las 'gal ba gcig nye bar bstan pa'i 'gal ba ni gnyis te /
translated: Of the two kinds of contradiction, the contradiction that is demonstrated is of two kinds:

original: rgyu mtshan ma tshang ba med pa'i yod pas med pa dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ma tshang ba med pa'i yod pas med pa dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the non-existence of something due to the non-completeness of the reason for its existence, and the characteristic of mutually exclusive natures.

original: 'dis ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i yang yul dang rang bzhin gyis sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu sgrub pa ni go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i yang yul dang rang bzhin gyis sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu sgrub pa ni go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The inference of the effect of contradiction is easy to understand as a branch of the proof by nature.

original: de lta na yang cung zad tsam gyis tha dad pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag bcu gcig po dag la yang rgyu 'gal ba'i khyab bya dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu dang 'gal ba'i khyab bya dmigs pa dang khyab byed dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang /

translated: Even so, in the eleven varieties of the application of non-apprehension of difference by the slightest degree, the apprehension of the pervaded that is contradictory with the cause, the apprehension of the pervaded that is contradictory with the effect, and the apprehension of the effect that is contradictory with the pervader,

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs pa dag la sgrub par byed pa'i sgrub pa bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa la sogs pa dag la sgrub par byed pa'i sgrub pa bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: the proof of the effect of contradiction, and so on, should be understood as explained in the proof by nature.

analyzed: de dang de'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dpes bstan pa 'di na du ba med de /

original: du ba yod pa'i @98b phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i @98b phyir ro //

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gal ba dang // khyab byed 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang // 'bras bu gzhan pa'i dngos por 'gyur //
